content:
Diagnosis:	Pineal parenchymal tumor of intermediate differentiation (WHO grade II)

Management:	15 Jan 2023 - Endoscopic biopsy and third ventriculostomy
		02 Mar 2023 - 54Gy in 30 fractions focal radiotherapy

Histology:	Ki-67 proliferation index 6%, no high-grade features

Current situation:	Routine surveillance MRI

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. The latest MRI brain (15/5/24) shows stable appearances of the residual pineal mass measuring 1.2 x 0.8cm, unchanged from previous imaging. There is no evidence of hydrocephalus. Her neurological examination remains normal with no new deficits. She reports good energy levels and has returned to work full-time. The mild headaches she experienced during radiotherapy have completely resolved. She will continue on our standard surveillance protocol with next MRI brain in 4 months and clinic review thereafter.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: pineal parenchymal tumor of intermediate differentiation, Ki-67 proliferation index 6%, no high-grade features

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows stable residual pineal mass measuring 1.2 x 0.8cm, no hydrocephalus

patient_facts.value: neurological examination normal with no deficits

status_updates.value: WHO grade II pineal parenchymal tumor treated with surgery and radiotherapy. Stable disease on surveillance imaging with good functional status
stable appearances of residual pineal mass on MRI
